reviews.review_msg: Quizzes were  unecessarily hard. The averages were always 310.  Available at office hours physically but not there to help. Always answers back with a vague question. Underlines issues with your paper but when you ask him to explain it, he will say it is not his job to write your paper. He made poetry boring and textbook was uneccessary.

Okay, this guy is not a prof, he's a fan. Obviously he is really into poetry (which kind of makes the class have interest) but the things he goes into detail about are THE MOST IRRELEVANT. Any knowledge I had about the poems was from the tutorial instructor (great guy). The class was not worth it & should have been called Poetry&Internet Relations.

lol the comment below. honestly, this course is good if u can BS ur points with justification while memorizing key poetry terms. final was WAY TOO LONG, too much to write. sometimes felt as if poems made no sense. mixed feelings about this class tbh
hes a good prof but a hard marker, the final should have been 3 hours instead of 2. too much to do in way too little time, and make sure to use MLA format properly on your essays he deducts marks
Absolutely the best prof there is out there. He's passionate about what he teaches and very articulate about what he expects in papers. I looked forward to going to his class every time.

Fantastic prof! His lectures are always interesting and at times mind blowing (for me at least). A really charismatic guy with a lot of passion for the subject. Fabulous lecturer! I never found myself bored in his class or looking at the clock. Very approachable too! Loved my TA as well! Lecture mandatory. Side note: he's also very attractive

He is so good looking.  Everything I go to lecture my mind is blown away by his amazingly profound interpretations of poetry.  I thought I was a fan of poetry but he transformed me into a poetry analyzing genius.  He is amazing, you actually enjoy going to lecture.  I was so sad when this class ended.  I would take this class again in a heartbeat.
The best Prof I've had. He's so spirited and interesting to listen to in lecture, he's fun, intelligent, and you can really tell that he's passionate about English.

I was frequently challenged and never bored by  Dr. Werth's lectures.  She is an engaging speaker who seems passionate about teaching.  If the opportunity arose, I would take another class with Tiffany.  As for her assignments, logical arguments presented clearly were key to writing strong essays.
Probably my favourite prof-he's funny,clear, and really knowledgable.. and hes a HOTTIE so lecture is never boring :)

As a guy, he's great. He's really accomidating and willing to answer questions and help you out. As a lecturer, terrible. He was boring, and completely un engaging. When you teach an 8:30 am class, you need to have a  bit of spice in your lecture, and there was none. I slept through the first few, so I stopped going. Also, my TA was pathetic.

I find all he does is read off of his many pages of paragraphs which makes it really boring(might also have to do with it being an 830am class). It is hard to follow which aspects he wants us to focus on in poetry. Overall, i'm not a fan of the course.
